text:
As our country is hideously divided & Dems prepare to filibuster the Justice Act—they want a political issue, not real reform or real civil rights protections—Nancy Pelosi engages in vicious, false race-baiting. 

Media: “yawn....Tear down another statue.” https://twitter.com/stevenportnoy/status/1275542871022735361 QT @stevenportnoy Nancy Pelosi says with their police reform proposals, Senate Republicans are "trying to get away with murder, actually -- the murder of George Floyd."

Hear it in this @CBSNewsRadio interview with my colleague @sfutterman:

https://soundcloud.com/cbs-news-radio/exclusive-1-on-1-with-house-speaker-nancy-pelosi
@BernieSanders Thanks tío! ☺️

Though I thought I had toiled in vain,for nothing and for naught spent my strength,
Yet my right is with the LORD,
my recompense is with my God.

Isaiah 49:4

The people in her district have spoken loudly and clearly about her leadership, her struggles for workers's rights, racial justice, climate change and many other issues. Taking on a well-funded opponent, Rep. Ocasio-Cortez won a landslide victory. Congratulations Alexandria. https://twitter.com/aoc/status/1275618050134474761 QT @AOC When I won in 2018, many dismissed our victory as a “fluke.”

Our win was treated as an aberration, or bc my opponent “didn’t try.”

So from the start, tonight’s race was important to me.

Tonight we are proving that the people’s movement in NY isn’t an accident. It‘s a mandate.

Today’s vote in Senate is NOT on GOP police bill

It’s only a vote to begin the process of making changes to the GOP bill

If after these changes are made they still don’t support it the Democrats could still block it

But it looks like they wont even allow that process to begin

The crazy radicals aren’t angry over racial inequality

They hate America & want to destroy it

Last night in Wisconsin they smashed windows at the statehouse,attacked a state senator & tore down a statue of an abolitionist who died trying to end slavery

https://www.jsonline.com/story/news/2020/06/24/madison-protesters-pull-down-forward-hans-christian-heg-statues-attack-senator-sculptures-in-lake/3247948001/ https://twitter.com/marcorubio/status/1275553723377385472 QT @marcorubio Racial disparities must be acknowledged & must be addressed. 
 
But not by giving in to a bunch of crazy radicals that don’t care about racial injustice & who hate & want to destroy America. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EbOtNjGXgAANqc5.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1275552954385346560/vid/480x270/nijkVo2vwMyxL_Ip.mp4?tag=13

Americans are in the streets demanding Congress come together in a bipartisan way & create meaningful police reforms that will save Black lives. Sadly, the Senate GOP bill doesn’t come close—it’s a political tool designed to fail. I won't stop fighting until we get this right. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1275785485374361600/img/9EEk7IsgdYMoLeMC.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1275785485374361600/vid/480x270/3Klz9pfKLTKQlt9X.mp4?tag=13

This is so out of touch with what the people are demanding.

The GOP policing reform bill fails across the board. It wouldn’t ban the chokehold that killed Mr. Garner; or allow George Floyd’s parents to sue the officers that killed him in federal court; or stop the no-knock entry that killed Breonna Taylor. The Republican policing bill doesn’t ban harmful policing practices, such as racial and religious profiling or no-knock warrants in drug cases. Joining @MSNBC at 10:45am ET this morning to discuss this and more.

Irony alert. Liberals want to defund the police but then ask “Where’s the police?”  

“Where’s The Police When You Need Them”: D.C. Delegate Asks The Right Question After Bizarre Incident Near White House – JONATHAN TURLEY https://jonathanturley.org/2020/06/24/wheres-the-police-when-you-need-them-d-c-delegate-asks-the-right-question-after-bizarre-incident-near-white-house/

Senate democrats are NOT voting to “block” GOP police reforms

They are blocking even beginning the process of voting on changes to it

If in the end they aren’t satisfied with the bill they would still have the votes to stop it

This crisis is far from over.

We absolutely must extend the $600 a week in expanded unemployment benefits that expires in July.

We cannot slash the incomes of millions of Americans by 50, 60, even 70 percent while the pandemic is still raging.

This is not a time to retreat into our corners—it’s a time to come together, Republicans and Democrats, and negotiate real reforms that can create transformative change to our broken system of policing. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EbR8BGuXYAE8l6h.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1275571465950289922/vid/320x320/6Nfm7dFROirs3voN.mp4?tag=13

It couldn’t be more clear that the Republicans’ attempt to pass their watered-down policing bill is meant to derail meaningful reform. 

Who do you trust on police reform—Mitch McConnell or the 138 civil rights groups who oppose the Republican bill?

When dissent is disallowed, which of our freedoms is next?

Defund the Thought Police | RealClearPolitics https://www.realclearpolitics.com/articles/2020/06/24/defund_the_thought_police__143523.html

RT @MarcACaputo Florida Democrats have opened up a 302,000-voter advantage over Republicans in vote-by-mail enrollment. In 2016, the D advantage was 8,800. 

Meantime, Biden leads Trump in polls of the state & Dems are up in voter registration

https://www.politico.com/states/florida/story/2020/06/24/florida-democrats-gain-vote-by-mail-advantage-1294263?nname=florida-playbook&nid=0000014f-1646-d88f-a1cf-5f46b4500000&nrid=0000014e-eee3-d0b3-a35f-ffe36b2c0000&nlid=630310

The GOP policing bill completely misses the mark. I cannot vote to move it forward. If the @SenateGOP is truly committed to ending the systemic racism that plagues policing in America, they'll support @SenKamalaHarris & @SenBooker's Justice in Policing Act & pass it immediately.

Real change in policing starts with accountability for police officers who kill unarmed Black people. An end to qualified immunity for law enforcement. A full ban on chokeholds and no-knock warrants. And strict standards and transparency around the use of force.

Communities across the country are demanding justice and an end to the police brutality that has stolen far too many Black lives. This moment calls for a complete transformation in policing in America, not empty words and tweaks around the edges.

The GOP police reform bill Mitch McConnell is asking us to vote on won’t deliver the change we need—and 130+ civil rights orgs agree. This bill is being pushed through a process that is designed to fail. Democrats & Republicans must join together and work to deliver real reform. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1275807651922919429/img/pWhmrokhk2ATnVxq.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1275807651922919429/vid/480x270/NZZcxxRPAh5fcqIb.mp4?tag=13

RT @DrCameronWebb Couldn’t go to bed without offering my heartfelt thanks to all those who participated in #VA05 Dem primary! 

Words can’t express how humbled I am by this nomination, but please know that I take this charge as seriously as any oath I’ve ever taken.

Now let’s go #FliptheFifth! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EbQpZbFX0AA_xPj.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EbQpZbJXYAEg6qT.jpg

Robert Julian-Borchak Williams was wrongfully arrested because racist facial recognition technology misidentified him for a crime he did not commit.

We can't allow this to happen again. It's time to ban facial recognition technology for policing.
 https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/technology/facial-recognition-arrest.html

RT @JamaalBowmanNY I’m a Black man raised by a single mother in a housing project. That story doesn’t usually end in Congress. 

But today, that 11-year old boy beaten by police is about to be your Representative.

I can't wait to get to DC and cause problems for those maintaining the status quo. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EbSeFheWoAAkAfj.jpg

Mitch McConnell led a process for the GOP policing reform bill that was designed to fail—and that’s what just happened. Joining my colleagues @SenSchumer, @SenatorDurbin & @SenKamalaHarris to talk about what needs to happen to get real policing reform. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xlKuvNrJSd8&feature=youtu.be

I just voted NO on advancing the Republicans' hollow policing bill. This bill is nothing more than a distraction to obstruct meaningful change.

Mitch McConnell is blocking the Senate's ability to enact real police reform. We need to pass our Justice in Policing Act.

Too many leaders are prematurely moving on from this crisis. The last time I checked, we were still fighting coronavirus—and losing. We have to expand testing and tracing, ramp up public manufacturing, and protect communities of color. We have to stop pretending this is over.
